channel.title: Examples on Microlith
channel.description: Recent content in Examples on Microlith

item.title: Tutorial
item.description: The complete code from the tutorial is available in the tutorial.com repository. Clone The repository should be cloned to the root of your Go workspace’s source tree, i.e. ${GOPATH}/src/tutorial.com. # Clone the repo to the root of your Go workspace's source tree mkdir -p "${GOPATH}/src/tutorial.com" git clone https://github.com/go-microlith/tutorial.com "${GOPATH}/src/tutorial.com" # Microlith will recreate this rm -rf "${GOPATH}/src/tutorial.com/.git/" # Build the application go install tutorial.com Bootstrap Assuming you own the domain name my-domain.

item.title: Blog
item.description: A blogging application with social features is available in the blog.com repository. It provides a basic API for performing CRUD operations on blog posts. It extends this API with comments on blog posts and with Facebook-style reactions (“Like”, “Love”, etc.) on both posts and comments. Clone The repository should be cloned to the root of your Go workspace’s source tree, i.e. ${GOPATH}/src/blog.com: # Clone the repo to the root of your Go workspace's source tree mkdir -p "${GOPATH}/src/blog.
